channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Pothole reappeared on corner and general poor condition of road, 9th November
item.description:
Just before the corner, the road surface is very bad and a pothole has reappeared.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): B4079, Oxenton, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Sunken manhole cover - been here for, 9th November
item.description:
It is in the middle of the road - workmen closed the road only a few yards from it last week. It has been here for a number of months. It is dangerous, damaging cars and could result in an accident.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): A435, Bishop's Cleeve
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Cycleway covered in Debris, 8th November
item.description:
Since the recent resurfacing of the B4063 between Churchdown and Cheltenham, the entire cycleway is now covered in debris. Rocks and chunks of tarmac litter the cycleway throughout, with the worst areas around Staverton Business park. Ideally the entire route needs sweeping but specific attention needs to be on the area outside Marshall Land Rover. There is also a considerable amount of glass on the route. It has been this way for almost 2 months now. It would be amazing if someone could be sent to give it a good clean, especially after the recent poor weather.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Old Gloucester Road, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pothole forming again, 8th November
item.description:
This has been reported and 'repaired' It was repaired about a week ago and is already breaking up, it needs to be repaired properly and not just patched up. It has heavy traffic consisting of cars and lorry's as it is right next to Walls exit.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Corinium Avenue, Barnwood, Gloucester
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: The sign is illegible problem, 8th November
item.description:

item.title: Leaf clearing is needed urgently around the Green as the leaves have collected and are obscuring the edge of the kerbs. At twilight, crossing the top of Newcourt Road roadI could not see the edge of the kerb due to large build up of leaves and went flying headfirst towards the wall. In addition to that danger, the build up of leaves filling the street drains is an additional problem the full length of the road., 8th November
item.description:
Large drifts of leaves on Newcourt Rd opposite the cul de sac, Charlton Close. Leaves and debris filling/blocking drains the full length of Newcourt Rd especially near the high wall opposite the bungalows.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 17, Belland Drive, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Bock gutter box in pavement, 7th November
item.description:
No 3 All Saints Road. We have had water ingress/flooding in the basement of this house. We have now had the gutter and down pipe cleaned out but water is still going down into the basement and fungus is now growing. Our contractor has been out to look at the black box gutter (pictured) but the section nearest the downpipe will remove the paving slab is moved and it is blocked causing water to keep running down the wall - this has been on going for 12 months we understand

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 3, All Saints' Road, Fairview, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
